clinical_study.brief_title: Corticosteroids in the Treatment of Tuberculous Pleurisy
clinical_study.official_title: A Multicenter, Placebo-Controlled, Double-Blind, Randomized Clinical Trial to Evaluate the Efficacy and Safety of Corticosteroids for Treatment of Patients With Tuberculous Pleurisy

collaborator.agency: National Natural Science Foundation of China
Bureau of Science and Technology of Guangxi Province, China

brief_summary.textblock: Tuberculous pleurisy is associated with inflammation and fibrosis. Adjunctive corticosteroids are used for tuberculous pleurisy because their anti-inflammatory effect is thought to minimise pleural reactivity and thereby reduce residual pleural thickening. The purpose is to evaluate the efficacy and safety of oral prednisolone for treatment of adult patients with tuberculous pleurisy.

primary_outcome.measure: Pulmonary function at completion of treatment

secondary_outcome.measure: Improvement in clinical symptoms and signs (such as pleuritic chest pain, temperature)
Failure rate at the end of treatment
